intro: Echites angustatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Echites angustatus is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its distinctive floral display.
